result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terri A Marley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terri A Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charge is dismissed and read into 2015CM1461 and 2015CM1125.

Defendant Terri A Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail motion addressed. Defense just received a pretrial offer and needs time to discuss this with her client. Defense requests bail be modified. State objects to bail modification. Court denies the request. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Terri A Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail addressed on 15CM1461. Defense requests bail be modified so defendant can wear the bracelet. State does not object to a reduction of cash bail. Court orders Cash bail remains as fixed on 15CM1461. Court will give another date for plea/sentencing on all files.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Terri A Marley in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date.  Court will give another date in September. Defendant has another matter - 15CT748 - that has a court date of 09/01/2015.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Dated July 6, 2015 filed by Attorney Perkins follow up letter to letter filed earlier in the day advising the Court the Defendant is scheduled for Jury Trial July 21, 22, 2015 in Branch 11.
Dated July 6, 2015 filed by Attorney Perkins  requesting an adjournment of the July 21, 2015 jury trial as the Defendant has new charges and they are working on a global resolution.
with attached witness list filed by the State.
Jury status hearing on July 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terri A Marley in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Perkins requests a trial date.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Terri A Marley in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is waiting for discovery materials. Defense requests one more date in a month. Court grants request. Defense to let the Court know on the next date if this matter will be set for a plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant allowed to return to the residence one time with a police escort to obtain her belongings.

Defendant Terri A Marley in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
